question: Which are the two basin countries of the "Artibonite River"?
explanation: Haiti and the Dominican Republic are the two basin countries of the "Artibonite River". The Artibonite River is the longest river in Haiti and the longest on the island of Hispaniola. It is also the second-longest river in the Caribbean, behind the Cauto River in Cuba. Forming part of the international border between Haiti and the Dominican Republic, the river's sources are in the Cordillera Central in the Dominican Republic.
